Reviews.Title: “A lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: Abikeira77
Reviews.Content: As everyone comments the hotel was well located for some of the major sights, just a short walk to the heart of Sultanahmet, with plenty of cafe's and restaurants in the surrounding area. The hotel itself is relatively small and has a nice quaint atmosphere about it. The staff were lovely which made you feel instantly welcome, and they would go out of their way assist you. I loved Istanbul, 4 nights there just wasn't enough to explore a vast city with so much history, i will definitely return, hopefully soon and would definitely stay at the Historia again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel with really helpful staff, thank u Historia:-)))”
Reviews.Author: Leyla S
Reviews.Content: The location of the hotel is great, 5 minutes walk to all the most important places to visit.We stayed there 7 days in March 2012 . Staff in Historia Hotel were wonderfully helpful & very friendly.... We had very comfortable and clean room with wonderful view... The breakfast was excellent and the service faultless. I would like to thank:Mr Onur,Vedat Ortekin,Muhammed Ancu and Mehmet... We miss u... Would be happy to stay again. leyla from Iran(tehran)

Reviews.Title: “The perfect place to stay in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: cristina h
Reviews.Content: Set in the heart of the old city amongst all the main attractions, location is not the only plus this great little hotel has to offer. The staff go above and beyond to be helpful and are always ready with a smile. An example; after an exhausting bus journey from Bulgaria, I arrived just before 7am. They welcomed me with tea in the lobby and breakfast at 7.30, although check-in is not until 13.30, they rushed to get my room ready for me and I was fast asleep in a clean, comfortable and spacious room by 10.30am. After waking fairly late in the day, they then went out to get me take-out delivered to my room as room-service. You really couldn't ask for more. As a lone traveller, I was always made to feel welcome by the other guests and the breakfast room was chatty with who had seen what the day before. All the main attractions are within walking distance avoiding the need for expensive taxi rides. A real mix of nationalities stay at this hotel, so you are bound to bump into some interesting people. I couldn't recommend it more 10/10.

Reviews.Title: “everything was fine”
Reviews.Author: kostasgrn
Reviews.Content: perfect location. we stayed there for two nights. the place was quite. breakfast was good. i was surprised from the staff. there were really friendly and helped us as much as possible.

Reviews.Title: “A gem Ä±n Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: Andrew S
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a real gem. Perfect location for sightseeing. Wonderful views of the Bospherus from our balcony. Excellent staff. Overall good value for money and a pleasant stay.

Reviews.Title: “6 night stay in December 2011”
Reviews.Author: DGKJIndiana
Reviews.Content: Staff very helpful, location excellent, but the bathroom smell is almost a deal breaker: The drains in the bathroom smell terribly. My husband thinks they have dry traps. You either suffer from that awful smell or the staff will turn on an offensive, electronic air freshner that reeks of fake pineapple. Both odors are really overwhelming. The wireless service is very spotty - quite annoying to my kids.

Reviews.Title: “Very helpful staff in a good location”
Reviews.Author: Arthur R
Reviews.Content: It was my first trip to Istanbul, so I had only maps to judge where the hotel was located: When there I realized the location is extremely convenient: the major sites, plus plenty of restaurants, are all close by. The staff was very helpful: when I left at 6:30 for a tour to Troy, I alone of those on the tour had a breakfast with me, courtesy of the hotel: this is just an example of the kind of help they provided me. of course none of this would matter if the rooms weren't comfortable: mine was very comfortable, with a very nice view of the Sea of Marmara. I will stay here again when the opportunity arises.

Reviews.Title: “historia hotel”
Reviews.Author: terryoldschool
Reviews.Content: very nice and helpful staff. Excellent location. Room was a bit small but we did not spend a lot of time there since there is so much to do in Istanbul

Reviews.Title: “Well run with outstanding location”
Reviews.Author: PlainVanilla
Reviews.Content: Let me begin by saying that I really wanted to give this property a 5 out of 5, and I wouldn't have been wrong to do so. There were just a few minor things that prevented this place from earning a perfect score. Your take away from reading this review, however, is that the Historia is a fantastic choice for your stay in Istanbul. First the great; Perfectly located in the Sultanahmet district of Istanbul with impressive views of the Bosphorus if your room has a balcony. My room was peaceful enough to make me not want to leave and look at anything else. Quite affordable. I actually spent the 1st part of my Istanbul vacation at a top US franchise "Big Box" business/luxury class hotel and that was very nice, well run with all the amenities that you would expect from that kind of property. And it was over twice what I paid at the Historia, witrhout the view or the local charm that the Historia delivered. Well run with professional, friendy manaagement and staff. Omar Sevgili, the Coordinator (which is Manager, I assume) is an impressive young entrepreneur with an excellent grasp of both the English language and the use of new media (Facebook, etc.).to promote his business. I'm a pretty cheap date as a hotel guest, but if I had required a lot of hand holding, I'm sure that the staff would have provided it. The breakfast buffet was very good, served in a discrete dinning room with garden terrace on the building's 2nd floor. Next the adequate; the property is clean and decently maintaned. Room service cleaned my room daily.; Towels and bathroom ameneties were acceptable. The building has a lift (elevator). It's not big, but it's perfectly adequate for getting up and down if you don't like stairs. It's not that you need to climb far anyway. My room was on the 6th floor, which is the top. That was two floors above the lobby and check in area, which is apparently street level (although it's listed as the 4th floor - building is on a hill, I guess). Room furnishings are not fancy, by any means,, but adequate and in good repair. Hot water was a little slow to get started in the evenings, probably because my room was on the top floor, but it did come. The shower faucet was a little tight, but functional. There were two available outlets in my room which, given the room size, was fine. There is also a train train that runs behind the property, but the train is electric and does not run that frequently (it's not the CTA), so noise was not a problem. Finally the needs some improvement section. The rooms are a bit small. My signle, while perfectly fine for me as a solo traveler, might have been a little tight quarers for two people. Thet could stand to upgrade their TV's from the old school 14" CRT flea market jobs to flat panels, and their reception on some of the channels was spotty. Wasn't a big issue for me, though. They could use coffee makers in their rooms. Having to walk around in public without my first cup of coffee is a cruel act for everyone concerned. While my room was cleaned every day, the drinking glasses that I used were not replaced. All in all, I highly recommend the Historia. I will personally stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Excellent Value”
Reviews.Author: Andrew255103
Reviews.Content: Myself and two friends stayed at the Hitstoria in Instanbul for a few nights of R&R in a business trip and we couldnt have been more pleased with the location of the hotel. The location was perfect with numerous restatuurants and Bars between the hotel and the Blue Mosque which is about 750 metres away. The rooms are comfortable if not luxurious and I couldnt recommend this more if you are looking for a more "rustic hotel expericne". The staff are great, the breakfast which is included is reasonable. Wifi is available and free. Ill stay here next time I go to Istanbul for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value!”
Reviews.Author: ami98
Reviews.Content: This little hotel is very well located in the historic area. The rooms with the view and balcony are great. The staff is VERY helpful and friendly and really made me feel welcome. I would stay stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Cozy hotel with memorable views”
Reviews.Author: gio_zar
Reviews.Content: the view we could enjoy from the balcony is itself one of the best memories of our trip! would definitely come back!

Reviews.Title: “Location and atmosphere”
Reviews.Author: mwha
Reviews.Content: We stayed at a basement room. Clean and good bed, basic bathroom. No view. Turkish buffet breakfast was good. Nice yogurts and fresh fruits and olives! Hotel staff was very friendly and helpful. Even better: Location: Sultan Ahmet: everyhing is on walking distance in the old town, Blue Mosque and Aya Sophia a stone throw away! area full with very nice restaurants for very reasonable prices! I would recommend this one who doesn't wish to stay in a five star deluxe hotel chain,

Reviews.Title: “Adequate Hotel in Great Location”
Reviews.Author: ruthfa
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 nights in early September. Positives - Fantasitc location you can walk to anywhere you want to go to and lots of restaurants within 2 mins - Breakast buffet was nice typically Turkish but well presented - We were given a balcony room (did not book one) and this was fantastic with a great view over the sea and the rooftops. Negatives - The room was really small -the bed was against the wall so one of us had trouble getting in and out - The bed was really really creaky - The air conditioning kept going off we kept having to call to reception where they had to "reset" something - quite annoying at nighttime - The drains from the toilet really smelt and an application of bleach would not go amiss - The cleaner kept leaving the window open after she had been (probably to combat the above) we found this a bit of a security risk. Overall I guess you get what you pay for. This hotel was a good price and the location does go along way to overcome any negatives.

Reviews.Title: “A Fantastic Boutique Hotel !!!”
Reviews.Author: jsulliv1
Reviews.Content: This hotel was superior.. the rooms charming, the staff most gracious & helpful the breakfast garden lovely & the food fantastic !!! I strongly recommend this hotel !!!

Reviews.Title: “Great location!”
Reviews.Author: Sally H
Reviews.Content: Stayed 4 nights at the Historia . Room adequate for our needs. Breakfast buffet okay. Loved the view from our balcony which allowed us to watch the ferry boats, cargo ships and cruise liners coming and going. Lots of little cafes/restaurants/bars close by. Area seemed safe for tourists. Very close to the Topkapi and Hagia Sophia. Local rail station just a few minutes walk away - 1 stop in to Sirkeci Station and then you are right by Galata Bridge.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant hotel, well located”
Reviews.Author: cratrav
Reviews.Content: Staff were extremely pleasant, friendly and helpful. Nice buffet breakfast. Some basement rooms are very small, other rooms are OK. Very close to the Blue Mosque.

Reviews.Title: “Glad I found Historia”
Reviews.Author: PepePilipinas
Reviews.Content: Friendly and helpful staff. Special mention to the female front deskn receptionist who will always take extra effort to extend assistance. (Terribly sorry to have forgotten her name.) Comfortable room with subtle luxuries. Generous buffet breakfast in a lovely mini-garden setting. So conveniently located in the old city, Sultanameth. Walking distance to major landmarks of Istanbul, restaurants and shops.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Friendly Staff, Small, but clean rooms”
Reviews.Author: TBO8
Reviews.Content: Spent several days with family in Sultanahmet and the location of the Historia Hotel was perfect for our explorations. Close to nightlife, restaurants, and many of the major sites, the staff was friendly and helpful in arranging activities. Rooms are basic, but the hotel did have rooms large enough to fit four people, and the rooms were clean. Some rooms do face the train track, but the passing train noise was never loud enough to wake us up. Parking is free, but only a few spaces are available right by the hotel and getting in and out can be difficult. Free wireless internet, but service was spotty in the room and better in the lobby.

Reviews.Title: “great little hotel”
Reviews.Author: NedaNe
Reviews.Content: Historia is a great little hotel, location is also great. 3 min from center of the city. Staff is very kind. Rooms are small but comfortable and nicely decorated. Breakfast buffet is a little bit poor but there are lot of great restaurants near by. Love this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “we wÄ±ll be back”
Reviews.Author: lisetty
Reviews.Content: we stayed for 4 days . Ä±t was clean and very nÄ±ce. the hotel Ä±s Ä±n the center of town Ä±t Ä±s the best place to stay. the staff was very helpful and frÄ±endly and made us feel at home Ä± would lÄ±ke to thank Haci. Alican. and Suzan for makÄ±ng our stay even better.

Reviews.Title: “In sum: Ideal location, Great Breakfast, Unparalleled Hospitality”
Reviews.Author: USF-SS
Reviews.Content: If you want to see Istanbul in all its glory, and be at the centre of it all, with walking distance to all the major attractions from Haga Sophia to the Blue Mosque, to Topkapi palace, the Basilica cisterns, the grand bazaare, hippodrome of Constantinople etc. Hotel Historia is where you should book your accommodations. By 'walking distance', I mean literally in the centre of Sultanahmet (old centre), a few steps from Haga Sophia and the Blue Mosque. My wife and I have been to the hotel twice and only have good things to say. Apart from the great location, the hotel is clean, cosy and the rooms are rather comfortable - we had a wonderful stay at the hotel, made more pleasant by hospitable, accommodating and knowledgeable hotel staff (who will tell you what to see, where to go in Istanbul: from museums to historical sites and where to find the best restaurants and night-life - we also had tours to outside of Istanbul booked through them -, great breakfast and all this, for an incredibly reasonable price (and all the Turkish tea you can drink :) While on both trips we didn't make use of it, I think they even offer airport shuttle service. You won't be disappointed and will cover all the major attractions on two feet.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly and central”
Reviews.Author: DannyGuy
Reviews.Content: My partner and I were looking for a small, authentic place, rather than a big chain hotel, and Historia was just what we had in mind - clean, comfortable, centrally located. It's near monuments, shops and restaurants. The staff at the concierge were happy to help us and they were very polite. Highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “A nice hotel and superb service!”
Reviews.Author: royrimstad
Reviews.Content: A small but very nice and cozy hotel. Definitely a place to recommend to those wanting a nice, small place with a great location right next to the key places to see and visit. And I'd like to remark that due to a misunderstanding I ended up paying twice for the room, and the hosts at Historia found my address at Facebook and contactet me to apologize for the mistake and to inform me that the money had been transferred back to me. Now, that's what I call good service and delivered with integrity. Thanx!

Reviews.Title: “Impeccable service, great location”
Reviews.Author: TallGuyWasHere
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Historia for 4 nights and loved it! The location is as good as it gets, in the heart of the historic centre. The wall of the garden where breakfast is served is actually the old city wall. The room had a lovely view of the Bosphorus. What I liked best was the impeccable service. Overall, this small, clean city hotel is an excellent choice.

Reviews.Title: “Turkish hospitality at its best”
Reviews.Author: Tamara1967
Reviews.Content: Historia is a lovely little hotel, located in the heart of Istanbul, 2-3 minutes walking distance from major city attractions, such as the Blue Mosque, Aya Sofya, underground Byzantine cistern, etc. Our room was on the 5th floor, with a beautiful sea view from the balcony. We started each day with strong Turkish coffee brought to our room, followed by a fresh and rich breakfast. The room was cosy and clean, and staff very friendly. I would strongly recommend hotel Historia for long and/or short stay

Reviews.Title: “We had a wonderful time”
Reviews.Author: markrossi61
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel Historia for 7 nights and had a wonderful time. We stayed in a basic room which was large and had a spacious bathroom. The staff was very helpful and polite. The breakfast was good with plenty of choice, including some hot dishes. We took a party of 7 people for belly dance classes and the staff organised a minibus at a fair price. All round I would say we are very happy customers. Thank you Historia.

Reviews.Title: “highly recommended hotel - thank you historia!”
Reviews.Author: ixcheladventures
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with friends from May 18th to June 2nd 2011. The staff were so friendly and helpful and made us very welcome. Thank you especially to Suzan on reception who made sure we were all happy with our rooms and the hotel service. Thank you too Hadji for making us so welcome when we arrived around midnight on our first day at the hotel. Hotel is in perfect location in Sultanhamet for Blue Mosque, Aya Sophia, Cistern and other places of specila interets. Rooms are very clean, the breakfast was delicious and there is a lovely courtyard if you want to eat breakfast outside of the dining room. I would be very happy to stay here again

Reviews.Title: “So good place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Erika0328
Reviews.Content: The location, guest room and breakfast were good. Also, the staff was really great! I got some problems in booking of a bus and asked them to deal with it after I came home. They talked to the bus company and solve the problems. 5-star staff and recommendable place to stay!

Reviews.Title: “Friendly staff and strategic location”
Reviews.Author: dinmo
Reviews.Content: This hotel has friendly and accommodating staff. I sort of felt that they wanted to ensure my security as I was staying alone at the hotel. They offered me to take their private van for a fee instead of hailing a taxi. They could also buy food for you from the restaurants nearby in case you don't want to go out anymore at night. The food at the breakfast nook serves good Turkish breakfast and has many varieties. The hotel has a computer at the lobby for the guests' use. The hotel is also strategically located at the Sultanahmet Area. It's close to the Blue Mosque, Topkapi Palace, the Harem, among many other museums and attractions in such area. My hotel room at the Historia had a view of the Marmara Sea so I found it nice as well. I could also see a railroad track where trains pass by every so often, but I was not annoyed by it. One thing I did not like about my room though was that the room carpet was filthy. Other than that, my room was fine.

Reviews.Title: “Very friendly staff and location on safety area, but small rooms and train + minaretÂ´s noise disturbet us.”
Reviews.Author: PaavoEinari
Reviews.Content: Good old hotel. Rooms are some degrees too small for old peoples. 6 floors, but new working elevator. Breakfast was decent+ Staff was friendly and helpful. As a first-time Istanbul-visitors we asked recommendations of hammamÂ´s, restaurantÂ´s etc. In reception miss named Bislan gave 100% good advices. (Bislan means "Only You" in english) Tip: We were playing couple rounds golf in Kemer GC. Even it is private GC, staff were very friendly and service in Club fine.

Reviews.Title: “Felt treated like a queen”
Reviews.Author: Dancer68
Reviews.Content: My comfortable room with balcony and top view at the bosphorus was simply perfect. After a rich breakfast the day starts well. The great location of the hotel in the middle of the old town in Sultanahmet allows to reach all main tourist attraction in walking distance. The service is amazing, and, because they understood that I had my birthday, they bought me a present and put it as a surprise in my room while I was in town. I highly recommend to stay in that hotel that provides you a feeling of being home.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, GREAT location”
Reviews.Author: Bogus-Blogus
Reviews.Content: This hotel is one of many of the same type in the old city. The rooms are small and functional. They are also safe and clean. The staff were friendly enough for a solo traveler. The breakfast is marginal but given the room rates, it was enough to satisfy. This is a very good bargain travel hotel in an awesome location. I would much rather stay here than at one of the Western hotels in Beyoglu. The nightlife is better there but the history is less.

Reviews.Title: “Find Another Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: AntonyTrento
Reviews.Content: We were looking so forward to our stay @ The Historia Hotel - we felt really let down! The lobby was filthy and smelled bad! Why not CLEAN / replace the carpet? No excuse for such nasty carpet! The desk staff would smoke on the terrace and the lobby smelled of smoke. Some of the desk staff were aloof and seemed annoyed or bothered that they even had to answer questions or deal with issues and some did not speak English well, which is not what I have encountered in other Istanbul hotels - My room # 606 was the smallest room I have ever seen - it was in the attic with a sloping ceiling, but it had a great balcony - the bathroom was a challenge as it was also tiny - The breakfast was very nice and with many more items than you normally see in Turkish hotels - The hotel website makes no mention that the hotel overlooks a railroad track, which was annoying - OK, so there are many hotels nearby this one - check them out before staying @ The Historia!

Reviews.Title: “Friendly throughout”
Reviews.Author: winghelram
Reviews.Content: The staff gives you the impression they are there for you all the time and very cordially.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay, will go back”
Reviews.Author: Jlr1013
Reviews.Content: What a great place, with an amazing and welcoming staff! The location is perfect if you're looking to be in the old city - easy walk to the Blue Mosque, Hippodrome, Hagia Sophia, Topkapi Palace, and a great selection of restaurants and shops nearby. The rooms are comfortable, a reasonable size for the area (we had a triple with 3 twin beds). It's probably an odd thing to call out, but their towels were fabulous - huge and absorbent! The breakfast every morning was a very nice selection of cold cuts, fruits, cheeses, eggs and bread/pastries with yummy yogurt and several types of homemade jams that were wonderful stirred into the yogurt or on toast. Good coffee and juices too. The staff really makes a difference though - always quick to help with any questions whether it be last minute arrangements for the hammam, or recommendations for restaurants. The free internet is a nice bonus too. Be sure to try the restaurant right next to the historia - their mint lemonade is beyond yummy. I would highly recommend this hotel and will stay there when I travel back to Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “We wanna go back!”
Reviews.Author: zrinka_os
Reviews.Content: Great hotel, great room, great breakfast, great stuff....our trip would't be so great without Historia Hotel! :)) Kisses from 4 girls from Croatia! Thank you for all!

Reviews.Title: “you won't go wrong”
Reviews.Author: VermonterTravels
Reviews.Content: this is a small (27-room) hotel on four floors with an elevator. Some of the rooms are quite small but very nicely designed to make use of even square inch. Bed was very comfortable and the balcony offered a great view of the Bosphorus. But the best part was the staff - everyone was delightful. and the breakfast room and breakfast garden were delightful. Breakfast was also very good and always included fresh melon, breads, eggs, juices, etc. and of course it is within easy walking distance of great restaurants, shops, and all the old city attractions - although the call to prayer from the Blue Mosque might just wake you up! But what fun! It's that close to everything.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and staff”
Reviews.Author: Illinois13
Reviews.Content: Hotel pick up at airport nice service (only one way if you stay for more than 3 nights). First impression walking into lobby, very grubby carpet (which was cleaned later that week). Room very small but balcony added nice extra space for our week stay - could do with comfortable chairs on balcony, even cheap plastic ones, when I asked for a comfortable chair ONE was brought up immediately (even though there were two of us in room). Bathroom quite sizeable compared to room. Staff very friendly and helpful. Free use of computer in lobby very convenient. Good breakfast included, could do with more tables on outdoor patio there were no tables for 2, only four tables set for 4 and these were mostly used by 2 people only. Had a lot of trouble with airconditioning, every night someone had to come up to fix it. It would've been nice to sleep with door and windows open, but too noisy with trains going by throughout the night and early morning kitchen noises from other hotels and of course very early call to prayer from close by mosque. Also had to close curtains as very bright lights from the mosque's minaret shone right into the room. Excellent location for walking to all major attractions and to tram. Great restaurants in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Location and Friendly Staff”
Reviews.Author: Stotties
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Historia with 10 and 12 yr old girls. Lovely hotel within walking distance to all the sights and just around the corner is a good range of restaurants and bars. We had a room with a balcony and view to the Bosphorus. Not a lot of space in the room and the bathroom tiny but who cares you spend very little time there. There is a railway line to the rear of the hotel and can be noisy but we were so tired from all the sightseeing we just crashed and didnt hear a thing not even the call to prayer in the morning. What makes this hotel aside from the location is the staff with a special thanks to Bahar who made so accommodating and friendly to our girls. Will certainly stay here again when we return to istanbul

Reviews.Title: “lovely hotel, great location, staff and food”
Reviews.Author: ju_919
Reviews.Content: We stayed 5 days in Istanbul to finish up a 3 week vacaion to Turkey. Historia hotel was the best choice to finish off our trip. The breakfast was fabulous and rooms were clean and cozy. We took a good rest after a long day walk. The staff was very friendly and helpful. Hopefully we can stay in a room with balcony and sea view next time.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel - Excellent Staff”
Reviews.Author: Hdervish
Reviews.Content: The service 100% perfect. The staff will bend over backwards to cater for your needs and are extremely honest. I had lost my wallet in the hotel which had Â£300 and cards. The bellboy (whose name I cannot recall) found my wallet and handed it in at reception. I anticipated having lost it for good. If you plan to attend the hotel in peak season anticipate a noisy evening neighbourhood; you are quite central. However you are a stones throw away from all major interesting architectural sites.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful location and atmosphere”
Reviews.Author: dianamalina
Reviews.Content: I spent one week in Historia Hotel in Istanbul; it was really very well located, close to the Blue Mosque and Saint Sophia, in a quiet area. The staff very nice as well. The hotel is small but very cosy with a Turkish traditional living -at reception. Nice place to stay when spending your holiday in Istanbul!

Reviews.Title: “Great value, nice place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: eventinggirl
Reviews.Content: We had a nice stay here for four nights. The room was large and clean, the AC worked well, the bathroom was fine and the location was excellent. Breakfast was also excellent and all was included in the price, which was the best we could find. The downs were that the internet only worked in certain parts of our room, the walls were thin so we could hear the neighbors (but the staff took care of quieting them down) and there is a train right behind the hotel (which had some noise every 30 minutes or so but not enough to wake me up and I'm a light sleeper). Overall it was a great stay though!

Reviews.Title: “Feeling at home in Turkey”
Reviews.Author: DorelleD
Reviews.Content: Initially I was a bit taken aback by the touristiness of Sultanahmet, but the staff at the Historia made me feel very relaxed. Our departure was delayed by the volcanic ash cloud and many travellers were feeling agitated. But the staff at the Historia were so calm and helpful that our anxiety was somewhat alleviated. The rooms were smallish and the call to prayer regularly woke us, but what else can you expect in Istanbul? Breakfasts were a feast.

Reviews.Title: “BEST OF ISTANBUL”
Reviews.Author: isabelma
Reviews.Content: The day I arrived to Istanbul was like a dream for me. The complimentary airport transfer was arranged by the hotel as I have booked directly with them.And it was perfect welcome. The hotel is more than what I have thought. The location of the hotel is perfect. All the historical places are in walking distance. (such as the Blue Mosque, Hagia Sophia, Topkapi Palace, The Cistern . . ) This is a real Ottoman Mansion located in the centre of the old peninsula. The superb breakfast has so many delicious varity of choices. And you can have your breakfast in the garden terrace which is very peaceful. And I have a lot of things to say about the staff . Thanks again for this unique service. I will definetly recommend

Reviews.Title: “Very nice local hotel. Good service. Friendly staff. Super location. Clean”
Reviews.Author: ritaockers
Reviews.Content: When you love to be in a not to big hotel, cosy and above all, local atmosphere, the Historia Hotel is excellent. Local atmosphere, but with all the luxery you need on vacation. Nice rooms, good beds, complete bathroom, television, hairdryer. Very friendly people work here. Nice and Clean. A nice little garden for breakfast. The location is super. The highlight are even to reach on foot. Short distance to the Bosporus.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location in a Beautiful City”
Reviews.Author: fxw87
Reviews.Content: I absolutely loved my stay in Istanbul, especially because every night, I would walk past the glorious Sultanahmet mosque and Hagia Sofia on my way back to Historia hotel. The weather was cool at the time we went so it was very pleasant to walk to the nearby tram (about 10 minutes away) and even all the way across the Galata bridge! There was a convenient food street somewhere along the tram line (but i'm sorry i can't remember the street name). We loved one of the restaurants named Et-is. The trick is to ask the locals where they would eat. And they are usually very friendly if you ask nicely (and of course don't ask the restaurant owners standing out by the street because they'll point to their own shops). The Spica Bazaar is about 20 minutes away but well worth the walk. Look around the Grand Bazaar but do your shopping in the Spice Bazaar! Prices go down to half or a third of Grand Bazaar prices. Anyway, staff in Historia Hotel were wonderfully helpful and were happy to explain directions and point out places of interest on the map. They were always courteous and helpful and it was a delight to have a lovely outdoor verandah to eat breakfast at. We got basement rooms which aren't consistent. Parent's room was nearly twice as big as ours! However, we spent most days out so this was not a big issue. The place definitely had its own charm, being one of many old converted houses in the area. I highly recommend Historia Hotel, and if you're still undecided, Istanbul as a great destination!

Reviews.Title: “great location, small friendly, attractive area”
Reviews.Author: Pikeman1963
Reviews.Content: our stay was over-shadowed by the great volcano ash crisis, and our tour company eventually moved us to a cheaper hotel when our flight home was cancelled. I would endorse many of the comments below. Breakfast was good; only time I had a hot option after a weeks trekking on south coast. This area is pretty, and so convenient for many sights. But it is a western enclave type zone, with higher prices and restaurants/bars aimed soley at westerners. Dropped lucky with a double room on the non-train track side, with a large terrace looking towards Blue Mosque - book Room 606 and you should not be disappointed! I would stay here again. There a many similar hotels all around.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, you can walk to all attractions in Sultanahmet”
Reviews.Author: Musafira
Reviews.Content: Nice small wooden house with clean rooms in a great location. Friendly staff, everything is not luxurious but very cosy.

Reviews.Title: “Not all rooms will give you a good nights sleep”
Reviews.Author: kdhs61
Reviews.Content: Have recently spent a long weekend in this very conveniently located small hotel. The staff were friendly and helpul, the breakfast good and the rooms clean and the beds cmfy. Just be warned that there is an active railway line and delivery alley that run along the back of the hotel and both are up and running from about 5.30am. Walls are also wafer thin so if the hotel is busy it can be quite noisy with people coming and going.

Reviews.Title: “great location once you find it”
Reviews.Author: ScubaSteph22
Reviews.Content: Its a short walk to all the sites and the train, so the location was actually great, once you get past all the pushy restaurant owners on your way to it. Our taxi driver didn't know where it was, and neither did the 15 or 20 people he asked on the way, luckily I spotted it as we drove by after a few dozen circles. We also got lost trying to find it on foot the next day, but after that we were fine, so print out an google map and bring it with you. The rooms are not well maintained or particularly nice, but it was clean and cheap so we were happy. The beds were comfortable. You can hear the trains go by but they aren't very loud, we slept through them without a problem.

Reviews.Title: “kind yet unobtrusive staff, convenient location”
Reviews.Author: Justin B
Reviews.Content: Very well treated by certain members of staff who showed a gentle hospitality and generosity. The location is very convenient and easy to find, a short walk from the Blue Mosque. Very good value, room was clean, reasonably quiet and breakfast was plentiful, varied, and good. The only possible downside is that the hotel is in an area of hotels and tourist restaurants and shops that resembles disneyland more than Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Best staff in a best city”
Reviews.Author: graspipa
Reviews.Content: Me and my girlfriend. Best for position and staff. The hotel is located in the heart of Sultanahmet, probably the best place to stay for visiting Istanbul. The room was essential but quite clean (no excellence...) and has the privat bathroom, the bar, the air conditioning system and the tv color. The staff was simply LOVELY!!! the girl at the reception was extremely friendly and help us for everything. THANK YOU!!! A cons?!? The rails are close to the hotel and sometime you can ear the train pass by...

Reviews.Title: “a very nice place to stay in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: BreakNY
Reviews.Content: I found the Historia Hotel on the web.... I wanted a clean and low priced place to stay and I found one. The place is right down the street from the Blue Mosque, my balcony was great to watch the traffic go up and down the street leading to the Mosque. I was surprised that the hotel is located in such an easy place to visit what I wanted to visit. The rooms are small and clean, the wifi worked great, the staff was excellent and helpful. The Breakfast was excellent and I could always get tea and coffee in the Lobby. When I ever get back to Istanbul, I will stay there again. I booked my room on line and it was easy!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice staff and service”
Reviews.Author: AprilTsui
Reviews.Content: Neat and nice room with beautiful sea view. Staff are really nice and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “What a view”
Reviews.Author: solfre
Reviews.Content: The room was on the top floor, very tiny (more suitable for a single room) and with no real space for luggage and the bed maybe too hard but the view from the terrace was everything. The staff was very service-minded and the hotel is very centrally situated in a nice area. For a few nights this hotel is a good choice. Good value for money although we think the smallest rooms should be less expensive than the bigger rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Historia”
Reviews.Author: Catsusie
Reviews.Content: OK for where it was and for a 3/4 nights. Def no longer. Central to all the main historical bits of Istanbul in the Sulthanhamet area.

Reviews.Title: “Great budget hotel with fantastic service”
Reviews.Author: Elektra511
Reviews.Content: We stayed there for four days. It's perfectly located in the toeristic area, minutes walking to Aya Sofia, Grand Bazaar, ... Clean rooms with airco working, an amazing staff who give the word service a new meaning, free internet use, a good breakfast, and all you can imagine.

Reviews.Title: “A clean hotel, excellent location and with competent staff”
Reviews.Author: walterpater
Reviews.Content: My family and I rented a quadroplex room for a 10-night stay. The price was moderate compared to other hotels of a similar rating and location. The hotel is very clean and is staffed by friendly English-speakers who were attentive to our few concerns. The breakfast selection is wide-ranging, consisting of approximately twenty-five different food items. There is a partially submerged electric rail link located approximately 1-km from the hotel, yet it is not as loud as the morning call to prayer.

Reviews.Title: “Very courtous and comfortable. Excellant Location, location, location!!!”
Reviews.Author: Mfarooqui
Reviews.Content: We recently went to Turkey on vacation for the first time. We were very much surprised by the courtous response we got. The hotel room at Historia was very nice and comfortable. the service was excellant. The breakfast buffet was great, we greatly enjoyed the fresh fruits and other items. The front desk receptionist and other people were very courtous and treated us their personal guests. I would highly recomend any one going to turkey to stay in Historia Hotel. And one more thing the location of the hotel was so great just walking distance to so many tourist attractions. We saved lots of money and time just walking to these attractions and restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, cozy place, helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: Lekki_1065
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very special. It was very easy to book it - no credit card information, just trust and good faith. Pick up at the airport in the midnight was a huge plus. The hotel is located in a charming old historical center, just a few steps from the Blue Mosque and Haya Sophya. There are handful of rather cheap restourants and cafees around. The stuff was very hospital and helpful but not obsessing. We did love our Istanbul long weekend and will be definitely back. Oh, we paid cash on arrival and as a bonus got a room with the sea-view balcony.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it...”
Reviews.Author: SimiKutty
Reviews.Content: It dint look all that impressive from the outside and the reception area was quite small. The elevator and the rooms were small too.But the view, friendliness of the staff, location of the hotel, etc made up for the 'smallness' or lack of space.The Blue Mosque, AyaSofya, etc are all within walking distance.Free Internet in a computer in the lobby was a bonus.The manager as well as the staff are quite helpful.Breakfast was alright, nothing special.I first stayed in room 604 which had an amazing view but dint have a balcony. Room 505 had a balcony with the same view.Rooms and bathrooms are clean and well-maintained. The water nozzle in the commode was not aligned right. Fresh towels everyday.Overall experience is good keeping in mind that Historia Hotel is not a luxurious hotel but a simple and clean one.

Reviews.Title: “historia happens to be a very good choice”
Reviews.Author: iboegypt
Reviews.Content: i visited hotel historia istanbul with my family at the beginning of december 2008 and stayed there for two nights, it's location happens to be terrific, since it's situated only a walking distance from the center of the sultan ahmet area (5 minutes walk to sultan ahmet mosque and agia sophia), i got a room with the sea view, and although the roomI got was very small but the view made up for the size (plus it was a holiday season). i was also able to find a parking spot for my car (since i travelled by car from ankara where i reside), and i didn't need to use the car cause of the centrality of the hotel. The staff was very friendly, and i would like to thank Mr. Barish (whom i know was strongly ctiticized by one of the previoius reviews) but actually i found him professional and extremely helpful to make sure that all our requests were fulfilled expiditously and with the utmost courtesy,to sum it up i would say that hotel historia is a good value for money accomodation in Istanbul (this was my 12th trip to istanbul in the last five years).

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommendable - excellent quality at great location &friendly staff !!!”
Reviews.Author: WienerMelange
Reviews.Content: My friend and I spent four full days in Istanbul at the beginning of October. We stayed at the Hotel Historia, which had been recommended to us by colleagues. It turned out to be all we could have hoped for! The two of us (both girls) rather spontaneoulsy embarked on this trip and left completely unprepared (without even a guide-book), merely with some recommendations we had recieved from friends and a print out of the compact information on the sites from the hotel's website. But preparation was unnecessary. To our extremely pleasant surprise all our needs were taken care of by the outstandingly friendly hotel staff!! Transfer to the hotel from the airport was arranged and upon arrival on our first day we were booked onto a Bosphorus boat tour within minutes. This was a suggestion by the manager we didn't regret, because the sunny weather did change according to the fore-cast a day later. Furthermore the staff was always helpful in suggesting sights, routes and restaurants. The hotel's location is simply perfect - it is in the Sultanahmet district right by the Blue Mosque, the church of Saint Sophia, TopkapÃ½ Palace, Basilica (Yerebatan) Cistern, Grand Bazaar and the Cemberlitas Hamam (which may be a disappointing experience for those familiar with western Spa's and thermal baths). The location definitely adds on to its charm -prayers are unlikely to be overheard. The hotel's amenities are simple and clean, the beds comfortable and the breakfast buffet rich. The price value ratio is excellent! Internet is available in the foyer. My friend and I left Istanbul with the most positive impressions (people were so friendly), the wish to return soon and the urge to recommend the friendly little Hotel Historia to all those wanting to go to Istanbul soon! Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Historia - small, clean and nicely formed”
Reviews.Author: Nichtstadt
Reviews.Content: Stayed for a week with friends, sightseeing. Easy to book via venere.com. The hotel is ideally located in a small cul de sac in Sultanamhet. This is only a few minutes walk from Haghia Sofia, Blue Mosque, Cavalry Bazaar, Mosaics Museum etc and lots of small restaurants, bars, shops. Our rooms overlooked the Bosphorus and one had a small balcony on which we drank the occasional bottle of wine and watched the sun go down. All these plus points mean that the area can be noisy on occasion - there is a railway close by but we did not find this a problem. The rooms are small but very clean. The beds were good as were showers. Plenty of hot water. Downsides for some might be the small size, there is no chair (only a stool to sit at) and no tea / coffee facilities in the rooms. Breakfast is a buffet in a downstairs patio from 7.30 to 10.30. There is plenty to eat and quality is OK rather than outstanding. There is no lunch or dinner but as the place is surrounded with such establishments (we liked the Cafe Sofa about 30 yards away) that is not a problem. There is free internet in front lobby and a small bar. Staff are very friendly and helpful though, like most Turks, their English is not up to dealing with anything very out of the ordinary so you need to allow time for those exlanations. (On the other hand my Turkish comprises about a dozen words). There is a lift to all floors except the top one. In summary, an excellent hotel for sightseeing but you are not getting, or paying for, luxury. If you need space and quiet then you should look elsewhere. I would certainly go back.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, good price.”
Reviews.Author: berurier
Reviews.Content: Wa stayed four nights in this hotel, a little hotel in a nice ottoman building. First, it's very well located, in the Sultanahmet area. Just 2 ou 3 minutes walk to Hagia Sofia. Our room was very large, and quiet (We sometime heard the Train passing, but it did not disturb us), which is so rare in the Sultanamet area. The room was clear. We paid 55 euros/night for a double room, with breakfast. I had this price via venere. I don't know the price proposed by the hotel's site. I would recommand this place with no hesitation at all.

Reviews.Title: “Ok for the price”
Reviews.Author: pseudonomad
Reviews.Content: Good points Location Price-Â£150/5 nights pp in a family room Prompt reply by hotel Clean Free Internet Great friendly staff Free one way shuttle if you stay more than 4 nights Breakfast -large selection Bad points Dated hotel-in need of repair Would i stay there again?probably

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic!!”
Reviews.Author: MKD81
Reviews.Content: This hotel exceeded my expectations on all fronts. The staff were friendly, attentive and efficient and the rooms were very comfortable. Most importantly, the rooms were spotless and the bathrooms were very clean and had consistent hot water. The hotel is located 10 minutes from the Sultanahmet tram stop, tucked away on a small, quiet cul-du-sac. For a small room with two single beds, we still had a balcony with a view overlooking the local neighborhood and the Sea of Marmara. The included breakfast was delicious, and featured great feta/phyllo squares and delicious yogurt and stewed apricots. I especially like that breakfast was offered until at least 10 a.m. There is also a full bar that was open until at least 12:30 a.m. and a beautiful glassed-in sun porch--a great place to enjoy coffee. If you plan to stay here, book early! We secured a prepaid $90/night rate through Expedia in February but when we arrived in April, they were offering the standard rate at 110 euros. I highly recommend Hotel Historia.

Reviews.Title: “A Must Stay Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Steve_Wall
Reviews.Content: I have been in Istanbul for two weeks for a business trip but it was like a great trip to such a wonderful city. The hospitality of Turkish people and people in this hotel was over the standards I have ever seen around the world. Located in the heart of historical places, this hotel will be my only choice at my future trips to Istanbul. This boutique hotel like a home managed by multinational hotel companies but at this beautiful home every person from the waitress to the manager is trying to please you. As I said, I will choose this hotel anytime I go to Istanbul and I highly recommend it to everyone...

Reviews.Title: “Live the HiSTORY at the most authantic Ottoman ManSion”
Reviews.Author: DeepNy
Reviews.Content: I just came back from Istanbul...I wanted to share the unforgettable moments at Historia Hotel...Firstly, the very first moment at Historia, I felt "at home." To explain in detail , I can say that the owner, a young gentleman welcomed us at the front door, while I and my husband were enjoying the "Turkish coffee" (I urge the espresso lovers to try the Turkish coffee)our room settled for us. Then, as we entered our room, we felt very lucky....We were staying in the middle of the ancient city but with the beautiful sea view from the Marmara. It was really amazing, I can still imagine sea gulls, flying in the sky...The open buffet breakfast was yummy:) a variety of cereals, combined with Turkish traditional breakfast specialties....I think I put on weight:( In general, the food in turkey is so delicious... I will never ever forget the moments at Istanbul but especially at Historia Hotel...The friendly staff, the owner, the kindest person I have ever seen, the magical atmosphere as being in the center of the ancient Istanbul.-surrounded by Blue Mosque, Hagia Sophia...this trip will remain as the unforgettable moments of my life... Thank you Historiaaaa....

Reviews.Title: “Dont stay at this hotel !!!!”
Reviews.Author: avidtraveller001
Reviews.Content: After reading all the positive reviews we went ahead with staying at this hotel. What a mistake. My husband and child arrived and were given a room next to the reception so had to endure loud voices all through the night until 4am! The city view room we were promised comprised of a view of a shabby rail track and old buildings. We were woken up throughout the night by the sound of trains rattling by. When we complained a very moody man by the name of Barish said if we waited around til mid day we would be given another room. This was even worse than the first. So we left only after a huge argument with Barish who was obviously very unhappy about having to refund us our money. I was appaulled by his rudeness and unprofessionalism as he yelled at the top of his voice in front of our petrified 3 year old son! Anyway it was a blessing in disguise because we found a hotel called the Emin hotel just a few meters away a beautiful new 3 star hotel where you felt like you were in a top class hotel. Lovely staff and incredible service. Try the Emin for the same price and triple the quality. Historia stinks!

Reviews.Title: “A place in my heart”
Reviews.Author: Eghi
Reviews.Content: Historia Hotel has very special place for me, better would say for us. There I started to date "my prince" and now we are engaged. Everyone welcomes to our wedding in August in Mongolia :-) After looking at dozen of hotels I chose this hotel, the man in a reception was very helpful also it has a very good location for a tourist, where you can fully feel the air of old city, and I'm really satisfied that I chose that hotel. The room with Bosphorus view was great.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, beautiful hotel, great service...a lovely stay !”
Reviews.Author: kbog2000
Reviews.Content: We spent few days in Historia the last october, and we keep very good memories still missing the famous turkish hospitality. Historia hotel is more than a great, warming, ottoman styleâ€™s hotel in Istanbul, you feel in Historia as your home.The friendly and helpfull staff go over and above our wishes to make our stay in Istanbul memorable. Before our arriving we e-mailed Onur, the Manager, who proposed to us the shuttle service from airport to the hotel and provided us information about the city and suggestions on tours and things to do. Historia is also very well situated. If you want to see the most important historical monuments, Historia is great. Situated in the historical area Â« Sultanahmet Â», we are at 2 minutes by walk to the Blue Mosque, Aya Sophia and closed by walk (just 10-15 min) to the Grand Bazaar, Topkapi Palace, turkish baths (ask a good adress to Onur), spices Bazar... Historia is also closed to all the facilities : the main road is at 10 minutes by walk, there, you have many travel agencies, shops of souvenirs, cashwithdraw machines, the tramway station to go for instance to the Â« Modern Istanbul Â» (15min by tram) or to take a boat to the oriental sideâ€¦Our room, with a great view on the marmara sea, was very cosy with all high standing facilities. We used to enjoy the traditionnal turkish breakfast in the very nice and sunny Historiaâ€™s garden. Internet with speed connection is also available for free in the cosy hall bar of the hotel. There is also a cheap shuttle service for the international airport. For us, have chosen Historia for our journey in Istanbul was a discover of the turkish hospitality, the sharing of the turkish culture with the generous and smiling hotelâ€™s staff, a warming time we canâ€™t forget. Donâ€™t choose between the high standing and the cheap price, Historia is the best deal you can do. In what concerns us, we are sure to come back in Historia for our next trip in Turkey !

Reviews.Title: “Warm people, you feel like home.”
Reviews.Author: max-titi
Reviews.Content: A nice simple and clean Hotel. It's close to the best monumets. We had some health problems and the staff has been very helpfull and kind. We apreciated the real turkish people hospitality.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: 3DTraveler
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel in a prime location in the Sultanahmet section of Istanbul. Two minutes walk to Blue Mosque; Less than 5 minutes walk to Aga Sofia and Hippodrome; Less than 10 minutes walk to Topkapi Palace. The only comment I would make about the area is that there are many carpet showrooms around the hotel and you will be approached by salesmen. However, I am a solo woman traveler, and I did not feel unsafe at any time walking around this area of the city. I stayed at this hotel twice -- at the beginning and at the end of my tour of Turkey. My comments are the same for both stays. Bear in mind, I am a budget traveler and tend to stay in less comfortable hotels, so my standards are simply a safe, clean, comfortable place to sleep and bathe. Therefore, if you require 5 stars, you may not agree with my review. Room clean and very comfortable, spacious by European standards. Small tub, but comfortable enough for a shower if somewhat awkward to get in to. Plenty of hot water. Very good breakfast spread, nice variety. Firm, but comfortable beds; crisp linens; and towels big enough to fit around a large woman like myself -- but I found those things to be the same in all of the hotels I stayed at in Turkey. However, the selection of TV channels in English was the best of all the hotels at which I stayed in Turkey. Decor was pleasing. The pillows were good, too. I can't attest to cost because this was part of a package tour. The staff (all young men) were very polite, helpful, and all spoke excellent English. If I were to return to Istanbul, I would definitely stay in this hotel again if it was within my budget.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value for budget travellers”
Reviews.Author: pageboy
Reviews.Content: Booked the Historia after reading reviews of other Hotels in this area, liked the idea of sea views from my room, which were spectacular looking over the Bosphorous and far away to Asia over the Sea of Marmara. All the facilities were as expected, clean and tidy room, very ample choice at breakfast. English speaking front desk open 24 hours. There is a railway at the rear of the Historia, the track situated down the hill and the slight noise was hardly noticable,guests who book a sea view will only see the train carriage roof, and the line is not very busy. With the location just a few minutes walk to all the major sights, and the tram stop at Sultanhamet, we were very pleased with our visit and would book again.
